summary: additional joinable site settings
description: this patch contains a collection of new settings for when a site is made joinable

of these new settings can be enabled/disabled disabled is the default via the features being introduced are joiner group places the joining user into a group specified by the maintainer join notification receive an email when a user joins the site exclude from public list of joinable sites limit by account maintainers select the account types that are able to join the site join from site browser ability for users to join sites through the site browser the exclude from public setting controls whether or not users will see the site in their list of joinable sites in the membership tool as well as if users are able to join the site through the site browser if that feature is enabled as it does not replicate or the existing site visibility function private or display in public site list as the existing feature controls whether or not the site will appear in the site browser at all
note the join notification aspect of this feature was not accepted by the community and as such is not in the community code base

the sakai.property for join notification is therefore not the sakai.properties introduced by this patch are sitemanage.join.allowedjoinableaccounttypecategories count list sitemanage.join.allowedjoinableaccounttypes count list sitemanage.join.allowedjoinableaccounttypelabels count list the sakai.properties used in the screenshots.pdf example are as follows master switch for all new joinable sites settings begin limit joinable sites by account type the following three lists are intended to make up a join table of category account type and display label since category account type is a relationship
the count for each must be the same otherwise nothing will display under this option
if any value is left empty unexpected results may occur

joinable sites joinable account types categories to organize account types this is the top level of the tree in the ui joinable sites account types that are selectable for joinable sites to be limited by these values are not displayed in the ui joinable sites labels displayed to the maintainer selecting limited roles for official joinable members on site access page this list corresponds with the sitemanage.join.allowedjoinableaccounttypes list for order and count to these values are the leaves of the tree in the ui and undergraduate students who are also staff studies students who are also graduate students who are also undergraduate students end limit joinable sites by account type

summary: jms service needed for passing around events in a more standard way
description: need to create a new event service that uses jms so that there are more options of ways to handle events and to implement event handling in a more standard way
this will go hand in hand with the new cluster caching efforts
more details about the service will be added to this issue
we have created a general jms service for sakai and an implementation of the sakai event tracking service to go along with it
our current jms implementation uses activemq and auto discovery to send messages to other sakai servers running in the cluster
it uses some sakai.properties for config but works with defaults and all that kind of fun stuff and requires you to disable the legacy eventtrackingservice to ensure you get the new one
it also requires allowing the jms api into shared but i assume this is not an there are extensive comments in the apis which explain the usage of all parts of the services

summary: gallery should show thumbnail images using a fixed width and switch from a table layout to a floating image layout
description: thumbnails the approach currently used to generate thumbnails is a static table with a percentage-based width holding images whose widths are set to in the past such techniques have sometimes been used to make images take up all available space in the browser window
in this case however it work
ie no longer reliably shrinks images with percentage-based widths
on the contrary the largest images stay their original size and the smallest images are enlarged to match
on firefox the resulting thumbnail sizes are unpredictable
not all images receive the same width or height and the new size has nothing to do with the original size
in my tests this results in oddities like images whose original widths are and pixels showing up in the browser with the widths and pixels
instead gallery should show thumbnail images using a fixed width of it would be good to make this settable by height will be left unspecified to maintain the original proportions of the image
to fill as much horizontal space as possible we will switch from a table layout to a floating image layout
this will also have the advantage of preventing horizontal scrolling when very long filenames like those produced by digital cameras are beneath images in table cells
for examples see ideally the thumbnail display should resemble the layout in fig below where none of the individual images are in any way distorted and maintain their correct aspect ratio

summary: create new evaluation setup page which does not use session state
description: the evaluation setup pages currently views need to be redone and consolidated into something much simpler
we need to define how to handle the cases of dates that are invalid or missing and setting that are invalid
this work has been started by fixing up the options and simplifying the view with various controls but it needs to be improved significantly
first step is to come up with a simplified way to present all the options to the user this means the selection needs to be moved onto the main screen and the first view should be removed
also the checks need to be added and determined how those should work
the email template editing should also be moved onto this screen and hidden using javascript which can reveal it later
second step is to decide how to handle the assigning of groups and confirmation portions of the evaluation creation process

there needs to be options for paging searching and mass selecting probably all js also we will need to add in the various js controls at this stage to ensure required fields are filled out and dates are valid for the first part of the view

summary: create a view for editing email templates
description: we need a view for editing email templates

a view which lists the current email templates in the system and allows for removal of ones and editing of default ones a view which allows the editing of a single email template which would be reached by clicking edit on view

summary: create a new db type to store an eval group and a participants list for that group
description: we will need the ability to create internal groups of users quickly so we can make up adhoc groups for evaluations so it seems that the way to handle this is by storing a group and the list of participants in system
one possible alternative is to create sites in sakai to store the list of participants but this does not seem like a good way to do things
in general we would need to store userids for all participants along with some field that indicates the user type and finally an email address
this would be creating an evaluationgroup and evaluationparticipant object in the database and probably a linking table as well
this is also important for freezing the list of evaluators and evaluatees when an evaluation starts so that it does not shift around
the potential advantage with doing this is that we will then be able to easily calculate the participants lists and total enrollments since they will be fixed
the disadvantage is that users may not understand why the enrollment updates are not appearing for their evaluation

summary: setup evaluations to use the new states partial/deleted
description: evaluations should use the partial and deleted states which are evaluation state evaluation is being created but user has not completed the creation process evaluations in the partial state will be purged out of the system if they are not completed to unqueue within hours partial inqueue active due closed viewable deleted public static final string partial evaluation state evaluation is removed and can no longer be accessed by the user evaluation data is maintained while in this state and locked cannot unlock but evaluation data is ideally we will figure out a way to unlock the items perhaps by only maintaining generated reports partial inqueue active due closed viewable deleted public static final string deleted there needs to be an extra job to purge out evaluations which are partial but not completed after a certain amount of time

there also needs to be a decision about how to handle evaluations in the deleted state should we even use this once the partial code is setup the perverse code which now handles evaluation setup should be rewritten to no longer use the session state data

summary: need better way to handle removal of evaluations with responses
description: the evaluation system needs to not actually remove evaluations and data related to them
the current idea is to hide the evaluations which the users remove but not actually remove them or the answers
the disadvantage here is that the associated with the evaluation will remain locked and unchangeable
still trying to decide the right way to handle this without ending up with huge masses of dead wood in the system

summary: competing servers in a cluster trying to do the same initialization
description: the idea here is that we need a way to ensure that we can run table on a single server to avoid running them on all servers in the cluster
basically a general locking strategy
this is critical since it will cause duplicate data loading in the case where there are multiple servers starting up for the first time
the thread on this in reverse chronological order if you depend on the session factory then that will init first followed by the service
hence its safe to update tables in the service

otherwise it would not be safe to use the session factory in the init of the or am i just lucky with wiki ian these suggestions are interesting but we are using hibernate and as far as i know there is not a way to check for the init in hibernate as the table init happens outside the control of your code
as far as best practices go there are a few pages that mention them i think there may be others

az i agree with this recommendation and would add that it also seems to be a reasonable pattern to recommend for quartz jobs it would for most jobs to automatically enforce run at most time without requiring configuration or scheduling tricks
if the job takes a longer amount of time than a few seconds it's probably also reasonable if possible to chunk the job and allow multiple nodes to do multiple chunks
admittedly this is probably more common in the quartz scenario than for initializing tables

jason did we make progress on the best practices library to the point where once we get consensus on this issue we have an authoritative place to document it imho on each node check for evidence of the initialization already being present
sql select if not open a transaction take out a lock on a flag indicating initialization checked in sql update run a sequence of sql statements commit the transaction
provided the time between and is not more than other nodes will either block at if there is a node doing or not perform the initialization
we have used this sequence in rwiki since should only be run if auto.ddl is true and if auto.ddl is false and you need to run you should probably throw an exception to prevent startup
you should also provide the initialization sql script so that dba's can run it manually but hth ian seems like this is worth sending out to the larger developer list

az dick to avoid the issue of having competing servers in a cluster trying to do the same initialization of the eval tables how about adding a new eval property which is the name of the server that should do the evaluation
in that way most servers can be set to wait until the data is initialized and the chosen one will be free to initialize the tables without fear of colliding with other servers
dave david haines ctools developer digital media commons university of michigan

summary: bad depedency problems with jobs logic and emails logic beans

summary: create the permissions token generator service

the parts are the hierarchy service the permissions token generator service and the evaluation transfer interface
the permissions token generator creates a unque permissions token for a set of users and tracks which users have those permissions
this allows the for a large number of users and permissions to be represented by a small number of tokens rather than attempting to track a large number of unique entries seperately
this is key to a hierarchy that will perform well

summary: add in locking code for the locking chain
description: the locking system needs to be functionally locking an unlocking the parts of the chain this will probably require an additional implementation class no api should be used though more notes will be added here and in the code to make this more clear

the functionality being implemented is documented here this is the text as of creation of this issue may change locking the locking logic is designed to make it easier to know if an entity should or should not be changed or removed locked entities can never be removed via the apis and should not be removed with direct access to the db locked entities can never be modified except in special cases evaluations are a special case some evaluation settings can be adjusted even if the evaluation itself is locked these settings are detailed in the code comments locking should never be modified directly on an object via a save method saveitem the locking for an entity is controlled by other entities so in most cases entities should not lock themselves the notable exception to this is when an expert item or scale is created that should not be removed lock methods entities must use the lock methods to lock other entities lock methods should not be called outside the logic layer despite the fact that they are accessible via apis locking process the locking process is a chain of entities that lock entities behind themselves in the chain when they are locked entities will use the lock methods to lock other entities when a chain of locks or unlocks is triggered this will be referred to as a lock cycle locking happens when the lock state of an entity not at the end of a chain changes locked entity will now lock all associated entities below itself in the chain unlocked entity will now unlock all associated entities below itself that are not locked by other locked entities unlock cycles are much more intensive that lock cycles chain of entities scale only locked and unlocked by other entities never locks anything end of the chain item items are locked once they are used in any locked template they can only unlock if they are not used in any locked templates lock and unlock associated scales template templates are locked once they are used in a single evaluation they can only unlock if they are not used in any locked evaluations lock and unlock associated items evaluation evaluations are locked once there is a single response associated with them can only unlock if they have no associated responses lock and unlock the associated template responses in general responses will be created locked and therefore their creation is the trigger point for most lock cycles lock and unlock the associated evaluation
